turns.speaker: RICCO
turns.text: See that patch of shirt? We wondered about the discoloration so he ran a spectro. On a lucky shot we picked up some traces of Trychticholorate. Nobody around here had ever heard of it.

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: Trychticholorate? Alright, it's an absorption catalyst in toxic waste accidents. It's pretty rare, they stopped making it a couple'a years ago.

turns.speaker: RICCO
turns.text: Probably got in Cosgrove's clothes in a gas state from the fire.

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: What the hell was it doing in the fire?

turns.speaker: RICCO
turns.text: That's your job.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: Shadow.

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: How ya doin', Ronald. Staying comfortable?

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: Didn't think you'd make it.

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: Wouldn't miss this for the world, pal.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: Who's this?

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: He works for me.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: Is he a fireman?  I like firemen.

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: You like everybody, Ronald.

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: You don't know him.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: I know you.

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: Knock it off. Now.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: Tell him about me, Shadow?

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: Ronald here likes telephones. Used to tape wooden matches to the bell striker and wrap it in cotton. Came up with a whole little thing there, didn't you Ronald? When you got bored, what did you do? You just started making calls... mostly day care centers and retirement homes, wasn't it?

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: Did he tell you how we finally met?

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: Nobody cares, Ronald.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: Oh, but it's a good story, Shadow. You're depriving our famous young friend here...

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: Sure Ronald? You're ready alright.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: Absolutely.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: -- Burn them.

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: And old ladies?

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: -- Burn them.

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: And the world -- the whole world.

turns.speaker: RONALD
turns.text: -- Burn it all.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: Got a cause?

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: Are the glory boys actually showing interest in Investigation's work? I may have a stroke.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: The glory boys just want to finish their report so they can go home.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: I'm working on it.

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: I deal with this stuff every day. But a fireman... you never get used to it.  What happened up there? He was a candidate. Did he pay attention? Was he listening?

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: ...He wasn't listening to the right thing...

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: What do you listen to, Stephen?

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: You don't know... nobody knows...

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: I might.

turns.speaker: STEPHEN
turns.text: It knows us. This one knows us.

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: I need that report, Lt.

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: Alderman Swayzak.

turns.speaker: SWAYZAK
turns.text: Investigator Rimgale.

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: I need to get in the trunk.

turns.speaker: SWAYZAK
turns.text: Inspector.

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: Alderman.

turns.speaker: SWAYZAK
turns.text: When are you going to catch the prick that's doing this, Don?

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: "Don?"

turns.speaker: SWAYZAK
turns.text: Don't you have any leads at all?

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: No Marty, I don't.

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: We still haven't found a connection between the victims.

turns.speaker: SWAYZAK
turns.text: Jesus, open your eyes! Seagrave, Cosgrove, and now Holcomb -- fried in a goddamn high-rise!

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: Holcomb? I didn't know the name of that victim had even been released yet.

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: Is there a connection between them, Alderman?

turns.speaker: SWAYZAK
turns.text: Just catch the son of a bitch.

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: Mr. Swayzak! How ya doin'?

turns.speaker: SWAYZAK
turns.text: Investigator...

turns.speaker: SWAYZAK
turns.text: I'm a little busy right now --

turns.speaker: SHADOW
turns.text: This'll only take a minute. There's two cops outside that want to ask you about this --

turns.speaker: ARIANE
turns.text: I'm gonna need some bread, man. This ain't fair. I'm always here for you, and you can't even take decent care of me. My landlord is bitching like a motherfucker! You're two months behind on the rent, Lieutenant!

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: Didya ever think of moving to a cheaper apartment? $3,500 a month is crazy, man!

turns.speaker: ARIANE
turns.text: It's nothing. This is New York, man...  Oh -- I forgot. Bowtay needs some cash to buy her new acting headshots out of the developers. It's a good investment, man. She could make serious money!

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: Brown Downtown... There hasn't been any smoking brown on the street in --

turns.speaker: ARIANE
turns.text: Who said anything about the fucking street. I've got more connects than you have, Lieutenant...

turns.speaker: ARIANE
turns.text: I can't get over what those guys did to her. I just can't.

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: They're alive, aren't they? Come on, man! Everyone's making such a fucking fuss, just because she's a nun. Just because she wears a penguin suit, the church puts up 50 G for the guys who dared to rape her. Do you think they'd put up a dime if you got raped? Of course not. Or even for your little sister? The virgin? Like shit they would.

turns.speaker: ARIANE
turns.text: Susie's not a virgin anymore.

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: She's fucking nine years old! Jesus Christ.

turns.speaker: ARIANE
turns.text: It's horrible. They burned her breasts with cigarettes. Christ.

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: Yeah? At least she's alive! I see people get killed every day! Worse yet, tortured first and then killed! The nuns got off easy. Jeez. Cigarette burns. Everyone's all upset about fucking cigarette burns. I'll show you cigarette burns!

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: The Church is a fucking racket. I know how they operate. I've been part of the racket since the first time some faggot priest spilt water on my head. My Aunt Lu says I was crying all the way through. Yeah, I know their game inside out. Now I'm free of it and I'm gonna stay that way.

turns.speaker: ARIANE
turns.text: I'm not talking about the fucking Church. Fuck the Church. But tell me. Do you believe in God?

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: What's to believe?

turns.speaker: ARIANE
turns.text: That Jesus Christ was the Son of God and he came to die for your sins.

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: People.

turns.speaker: ARIANE
turns.text: You believe that man is the be-all and end-all?

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ARIANE
turns.text: OK. OK. Fine. But -- do you believe in God?

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: It's not the drugs, Ariane, it's -- it's someone who wants to kill me.  You gotta believe me!

turns.speaker: ARIANE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: Christ! Shit! I could kill them all with my bare hands.

turns.speaker: ARIANE
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: Those fucking Mob assholes.

turns.speaker: ARIANE
turns.text: C'mere. You got some good blow, right?

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ARIANE
turns.text: Then c'mere. I got something for you.

turns.speaker: ARIANE
turns.text: First I'll put your Uptown in the spoon, then, to make it more exciting, I'm gonna add some Downtown. They call this thing a speedball, honey, but then you must know that...  First time shooting up?

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: Nah...

turns.speaker: ARIANE
turns.text: Sure it is. You're a virgin. Just like that nun. And I'm gonna rape you.

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: Can you believe the nerve of this fucking guy? He kills people for fun, and then, he puts up 100 G to bring in some guys who raped a nun. What a sick fuck. Man...

turns.speaker: ARIANE
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: A wiseguy. Paying 100 Grand for the rapists if I turn then over direct to him.

turns.speaker: ARIANE
turns.text: But you could do it, baby. We could use the bread...

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: You mean you could use it.

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: I got it, man! I will find those kids. And I'll get the 50 G from the Church! Then the kids'll go to jail. I'll be in charge, of course. After a little while, I'll break the fuckers out -- and I'll turn them in to shithead I was just talking to. And pick up his 100 G. No. I'll hit him up for 200 G. Or 250 G. l can do it -- 'cause I've got the kids. Then, of course, there's the 180 G I'm gonna pick up on the Game tonight -- when the Strawberries win!

turns.speaker: ARIANE
turns.text: "The Strawberries"?

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: The Mets. So anyway, chalk up another 180 G for the Game. Jesus Christ! That's almost half a million dollars. Ariane! Wait. That's not good enough, I'll ask the shithead for 280 G for the kids. Then it'll be a perfect 500 thousand. Yeah. Perfect. 280 G for the kids. Yeah, it's good I prepared, or I wouldn't have thought to --

turns.speaker: ARIANE
turns.text: How come all those guys who're looking to get 50 from the Church haven't come up with shit? You got some kinda inside track?

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: I'm a Catholic.

turns.speaker: FENCE
turns.text: You took the chalice.

turns.speaker: ELDERLY BLACK WOMAN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: FENCE
turns.text: You brought it back to the Church. And then it made it's way back to me, again.

turns.speaker: ELDERLY BLACK WOMAN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ELDERLY BLACK WOMAN
turns.text: Are you all right, honey?

turns.speaker: FENCE
turns.text: I was gonna bring it back myself.

turns.speaker: FENCE
turns.text: So what are you doing here?

turns.speaker: ELDERLY BLACK WOMAN
turns.text: He wants to know who brought in the chalice.

turns.speaker: FENCE
turns.text: That's no mystery. Julio and Paolo brought it in,  You don't want to hurt those boys, do you? I mean, they sure as Hell have got something coming, but it ain't what the Law wants to give them. You understand?  No. How could you understand.

turns.speaker: JC
turns.text: That stuff'll kill you quick, man.

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: What the fuck are you? A drug counselor or a drug dealer? And you don't even do your own product! What kind of businessman are you?

turns.speaker: JC
turns.text: The rich kind.  Jeez, man. The way you smoke that shit is suicide.

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: Fuck you.  Just give me back a little something for the road.

turns.speaker: JC
turns.text: How are you doing, man?

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: Very good. Very good. The Mets are gonna win tomorrow.

turns.speaker: JC
turns.text: There. Now you've got your profit and more. You'll have more product day after tomorrow, right?

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: Uh - right. Sure. The Mets are gonna win tomorrow.

turns.speaker: JC
turns.text: I know.  Take care of yourself, man, OK? Be cool.

turns.speaker: JESUS
turns.text: I forgive you.

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: Me?

turns.speaker: JESUS
turns.text: I forgive you.

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: You can't forgive me. After what I've done.  I've fucked up bigtime. I've been bad. Real bad.

turns.speaker: JESUS
turns.text: I forgive you.

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: Please. Please don't forgive me. I've always hated you for that.

turns.speaker: JESUS
turns.text: I forgive you.

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: Why? Why can't you hate me? Hate me! Please! Help me!  Hate me! Help me! Hate me!

turns.speaker: JESUS
turns.text: I forgive you.

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: Why? Jesus! Why me? Why can't I wash the ashes from my forehead, year after year after year? And why am I still drunk on your blood, the taste of your flesh on my tongue? Worst of all, why can't I feel the nails in my palms, the spear in my side, the crown of thorns round my head? Why do I have to know, over and over, that it was you. You who died; died for my sins! And that I will die for nothing. Why?

turns.speaker: JESUS
turns.text: I forgive you.

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: Why do I dream every night of the whore who brought you water on your road to death? And why have I never forgotten that if she, then I --

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: Oh God, my God. it's goddamn good to be good. Forgive me. Father, for I have sinned. It's still goddamn good to be good.

turns.speaker: JESUS
turns.text: I forgive you.

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: Large?

turns.speaker: LARGE
turns.text: All right, cop. I want my money.

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: It's still my money. If you want to have a chance at any part of it, shithead, you will take my $120,000 and bet on tomorrow's game.

turns.speaker: LARGE
turns.text: What about the money you owe me on yesterday's game?

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: Fuck yesterday's game. The World Series is seven games not six. Put in my bet.

turns.speaker: LARGE
turns.text: Let me think about it.

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: There's nothing to think about. Either you put in my bet or you ain't getting nothing.

turns.speaker: LARGE
turns.text: Oh, really?

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: Yeah, really. I'm no fucking asshole, man. I'm a fucking cop!

turns.speaker: LARGE
turns.text: OK, cop. I want you to give yourself and your friends on the force a message. Tell them I've got my own reasons to be very interested in whomever did the job on the nuns. I'll double the Church reward if you bring those punks direct to me. 100 G cash. Get it?

turns.speaker: LARGE
turns.text: Here's the deal: You meet me tonight across from the Garden. 33rd & 8th. At the beginning of the Ninth Inning. We'll listen to the end of the game together. You bring your cash, I'll bring mine.

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: Yeah, sucker. You better be there!

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: I got them all going for Oakland. With bullshit money. We'll cover the $800.

turns.speaker: LITE
turns.text: All right. What are you gonna do?

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: I want 15 on the Mets.

turns.speaker: LITE
turns.text: How about 7 1/2?

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: Hey, man. Don't give me that bullshit. Don't pussy-out on me. The Mets are a fucking lock. I wanna make some money.

turns.speaker: LITE
turns.text: Are you sure?

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: Yeah. I'm sure.

turns.speaker: LITE
turns.text: OK asshole. You owe thirty grand. Now what are you gonna do?

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: I wanna go double or nothing on the next game.

turns.speaker: LITE
turns.text: Double or nothing? Are you fucking out of your mind?

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: I'm not gonna let that bastard take my money

turns.speaker: LITE
turns.text: Take your money? This guy will blow up your house and everyone in it!

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: There's just no way the Mets will lose this game. Gooden is pitching and Strawberry is ready to break out.

turns.speaker: LITE
turns.text: Fuck Strawberry. You're gonna end up owing 60 G to a homicidal maniac!

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: That's my problem. Just put in my bet.

turns.speaker: LITE
turns.text: Do you have the money?

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: What money?

turns.speaker: LITE
turns.text: Don't bullshit me.

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: I don't got it. Not tonight. You can't get blood from a stone.

turns.speaker: LITE
turns.text: This psycho can.

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: Oooo... Big fucking scary guy. Just put $120,000 on tomorrow's game.

turns.speaker: LITE
turns.text: You're a fucking joke, you know that?  He's been waiting for the money since the fucking game ended. And I've been waiting here since -- forget it. Listen up. You're gonna get us both fucking killed. You know that!

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: Uh-uh. I'm gonna win. Just make sure the bet gets in.

turns.speaker: LITE
turns.text: You do know that he's gonna blow up your house, kill your wife and kids --

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: Good. I'll give him an extra 10 grand for his trouble. I hate that motherfucking house and --

turns.speaker: LITE
turns.text: He's gonna kill you, man. Do you hear me, motherfucker? You. Dead. Get it?

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: I've been dodging bullets since I was fourteen. No one can kill me. I'm fucking blessed. I'm fucking Catholic.

turns.speaker: LITE
turns.text: How's the case going?

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: What case?

turns.speaker: LITE
turns.text: The fucking rapists, man. The punks who raped that nun. The $50,000 reward from the Church! Remember?

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: Yeah. Sure. Yeah. We're on it bigtime. Lots of leads. You bet.

turns.speaker: LITE
turns.text: That 50 G could help you --

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: Get this, man. I was at the game today. Face to fucking face with Strawberry! Jesus! I saw him strikeout. And you know what? He looked at me, and I looked at him, and he laughed and I laughed and it was like we were all alone in that whole stadium and only we understood that it was all a racket, that he struck out on purpose, and that he's saving it up for the Big One. Tomorrow. Today I understood for the very first time that --

turns.speaker: LITE
turns.text: You've really got a problem.

turns.speaker: LT
turns.text: -- that there was never any other way it could have gone.  Never any other way. So you had better just put in my fucking bet. $120,000 on the last game. The Big One. Come on! Are you a bookmaker, or fucking what?

turns.speaker: LITE
turns.text: Here. Look I'll give you the psyho's number You call him yourself and tell him wnat you want.

turns.speaker: NUN
turns.text: Forgive me Father, for I have sinned. It has been two days since my last confession. Father, my sin is a terrible sin. A sin of omission. There was another sin that happened at the same time, and in the same place, but my sin I think was graver stil.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: Sister, we all know what happened to you yesterday morning. I expected that you would want to speak to me about it. But you could have come to my office. Your being here, in the confessional, implies that you, Sister, have done something wrong. You haven't. I assure you. I feared you might have misplaced feelings of guilt. If you condemn yourself because you experienced feelings of... curiosity or even... pleasure, you mustn't --

turns.speaker: NUN
turns.text: Father, if it was so trivial, so natural, so -- No. I have sinned. And you must listen if you are to prescribe an appropriate act of contrition, and to absolve me. Father, what would you do if you had but one day in which to use your arms to serve God?

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: It's funny, you knew. But the first thing I think of is kneading the bread that I help bake for the soup kitchen. Maybe that's because my the muscles in my arms still hurt.

turns.speaker: NUN
turns.text: I also thought of that bread, Father. And of that night six days ago when the Mother Superior died, and I kept the cool, damp cloth on her forehead freshly moist. Father, what would you do if you had but one day in which to use your legs to serve God?

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: I think of running for help, and falling to my knees in prayer.

turns.speaker: NUN
turns.text: As I have prayed day and night since the desecration of this church yesterday morning -- and my sin. You see, Father --

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: Yes, Sister?

turns.speaker: NUN
turns.text: Yesterday morning, God gave me but one chance to use something else to serve Him. Not my arms or my legs, but something I used for the first time, for the last time, and will never use again. My vagina.

turns.speaker: NUN
turns.text: Those boys, those sad, raging boys... They came to me as the needy do. And like many of the needy, they were rude. Like all the needy, they took. And like all the needy, they needed.  Father. I knew them; They learn in our school. And play in our schoolyard. And they are good boys.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: You knew them?  Who were they, Sister? Who are these boys? What are the names of these -- good boys you knew?

turns.speaker: 1/16TH BLACK
turns.text: Yo, Big Black, we needs a name for this joint.

turns.speaker: BIG BLACK
turns.text: How 'bout...

turns.speaker: 1/16TH BLACK
turns.text: BLAK OUT.  BLAK LISTED.  BLAK BALL. Need I say more.

turns.speaker: BIG BLACK
turns.text: B-L-A-K it is.

turns.speaker: BIG BLACK
turns.text: Keep trying.

turns.speaker: 1/16TH BLACK
turns.text: I'm on it.

turns.speaker: 1/16TH BLACK
turns.text: ...Benedict Arnold...

turns.speaker: BIG BLACK
turns.text: ...that simpleton is holding back the race.  They got rid of us and keep those two buffoons, Mantan and Sleep 'N Eat, y'knowwhatI'msayin'?

turns.speaker: BIG BLACK
turns.text: Same thing, y'knowwhatI'msayin', y'knowwhatI'msayin'!

turns.speaker: 1/16TH BLACK
turns.text: We know.  We know.  Yo, check it, my black brothers, we can't let this slide.  Not this injustice. Nah, no way.  Dem' two real coons iz ill.

turns.speaker: BIG BLACK
turns.text: 1/16, tru' 'dat.  True 'dat.

turns.speaker: BIG BLACK
turns.text: He gots to be did.

turns.speaker: 1/16TH BLACK
turns.text: Did he gots to be.

turns.speaker: BIG BLACK
turns.text: You truly are a dancing fool.

turns.speaker: 1/16TH BLACK
turns.text: Yo Black, you looking for trouble.

turns.speaker: HONEYCUTT
turns.text: Everybody say Ho!

turns.speaker: AUDIENCE
turns.text: Ho!

turns.speaker: HONEYCUTT
turns.text: That'swhatI'mtalkin'bout! That'swhatI'mtalkin'bout!  I want to be the first to welcome you to the second taping of Mantan - The New Millennium Minstrel Show.

turns.speaker: HONEYCUTT
turns.text: My name is Honeycutt and I want to try something different.  Can you do this for me?

turns.speaker: AUDIENCE
turns.text: Yeah!

turns.speaker: HONEYCUTT
turns.text: I'm gonna start a chant and I want y'all to follow me.  Let's make our own 2 real coons know you're ready to start the show.

turns.speaker: HONEYCUTT
turns.text: C'mon.  It's easy.  It's the same thing y'all do out at the Yankee game, no different 'cept we changing one word.  Everybody go it?

turns.speaker: AUDIENCE
turns.text: YEAH!

turns.speaker: HONEYCUTT
turns.text: Alright.  Here we go.  Let's go NIGGERS!  LET'S GO NIGGERS!

turns.speaker: AUDIENCE
turns.text: Let's go NIGGERS.

turns.speaker: AUDIENCE
turns.text: Let's go niggers!

turns.speaker: HONEYCUTT
turns.text: Louder.  They can't hear you.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: You idiot.  You almost gave me a massive coronary.

turns.speaker: BIG BLACK
turns.text: I didn't mean to scare you like that.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: Well you did.

turns.speaker: BIG BLACK
turns.text: Give me some?

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: I'm not huggin' you in the middle of the street.  You must be crazy, Julius.

turns.speaker: BIG BLACK
turns.text: Whoa, hold up li'l sis'.  I done told you 'bout that.  Julius ain't my name, you better recognize Hopkins was our slave name.  My true name is...

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: I'm not callin you Big Black Africa. Mommy and Daddy named you Julius.

turns.speaker: BIG BLACK
turns.text: BIG BLACK is the first name and AFRICA is the last.

turns.speaker: BIG BLACK
turns.text: Damn, Sis, you don't keep no food up in here in dis' piece.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: I order out mostly.  So what do I owe this visit to?

turns.speaker: BIG BLACK
turns.text: My group we need some exposure. Was wondering if you could hook a brother up?

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: Hook you up?  The Mau-Mau's?  You must be smoking.  Why in the world would I want to hook up a bunch of red, black and green flag-waving pseudo revolutionairies?

turns.speaker: BIG BLACK
turns.text: So now I see where you're coming from.  Just because we ain't rapping about Gucci, Timberland, Rolex, Benz, Cristal, ho's and bitches, we're pseudo.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: Who are you revolting against?

turns.speaker: BIG BLACK
turns.text: We're revolting against the powers that be, that been enslaving the minds and hearts of all people of color.  And we won't stop rapping till we bring about the overthrow of the government of the U.S. of A.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: Please.

turns.speaker: BIG BLACK
turns.text: If you were really down you would get us together with that boss of yours.  What's his name again?

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: Delacroix.

turns.speaker: BIG BLACK
turns.text: Yeah, him.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: What makes you think he would write a show about the Mau-Mau's.

turns.speaker: BIG BLACK
turns.text: C'mon, why not?  The Monkees had a show.  Look at all that other junk that's on TV.  We got underground cult following.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: You don't have the demographics.

turns.speaker: BIG BLACK
turns.text: So are you telling me that you wouldn't even introduce me to Delacroix or set up a meeting?  I'm talking 'bout me, your only brother, ya own flesh and blood, hook a brother up, youknowwhatI'msayin'.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: That'swhatI'msayin'.  I'm not blowin' my young career, brother or no brother, for you or anybody else.

turns.speaker: BIG BLACK
turns.text: There is a name, a term for your kind, the likes of you.  Back in slavery days, you would be classified as a house nigga.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: If you think I'm a house nigga then that's your prerogative.  You got your ways to affect change, I have mine.  And I would appreciate it very much if you took ya field nigga ass out of my house.

turns.speaker: BIG BLACK
turns.text: My own sister throwin' me out.  I hope to seeya later when you get ya mind right.  Don't bother letting me out.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: That's mighty black of you.

turns.speaker: BIG BLACK
turns.text: The Mau-Mau's are up in dis place. That's right, the Mau-Mau's.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: What's your name?

turns.speaker: BIG BLACK
turns.text: My righteous name is BIG BLACK.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: And what are the Mau-Mau's going to do for us today?

turns.speaker: BIG BLACK
turns.text: We gonna drop some knowledge, wisdom and understanding.  The Mau- Mau's, we be scientists.  We drop science.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: We're ready when you are.

turns.speaker: BIG BLACK
turns.text: Microphone check.  One.  Two.  One. Two.  One.  Two.  Hold up.  I gots to give my peeps some props. Brothers introduce yourself.

turns.speaker: TAVIS SMILEY
turns.text: Our first caller is Big Black from Brooklyn.  Go 'head.

turns.speaker: BIG BLACK
turns.text: Microphone check, one, two.  One, two.  Yo Tavis, I be lovin' yo show but Mantan you is foul.  Why you perpetrating?  You a sellout.

turns.speaker: TAVIS SMILEY
turns.text: And Big Black from Brooklyn, what do you do?

turns.speaker: BIG BLACK
turns.text: What do I do?

turns.speaker: TAVIS SMILEY
turns.text: What do you do?

turns.speaker: BIG BLACK
turns.text: I'm a revolutionary.

turns.speaker: BIG BLACK
turns.text: And another thing, you better stay away from my sister or you better...

turns.speaker: TAVIS SMILEY
turns.text: Ladies and gentlemen, there is no need to go there.  We can all agree to disagree without making threats.

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: Life is beginning to look up.  It's all good in da neighborhood.

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: You might be right.

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: Why are you smiling so?

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: I'm not smiling.

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: Naw, not you.  It can't be.  That hottie Sloan Hopkins.

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: It's that bad, huh?  It's all over my face.

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: No shame in ya game.  She got ya nostrils, ya chnoz is wide open. Sloan's what we certified ladies' men call low hanging fruit.

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: Certified ladies' man, huh?

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: She's also moorish.

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: Moorish.  Ya get a little taste of dat booty, ya wanna get some MORE.

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: Seconds and thirds, too.

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: Sloan is all 'dat.  I try her.  I'm a tri-sexual.

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: You'd try anything.  I got first dibs.  You get ya own stuff.

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: Naw, just jokin'.  That's you. That's you.

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: DeLa - what's the matter with you.

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: You ain't happy about the green light?

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: What's wrong with him?

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: Must be the pressure.

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: Please, have a seat.

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: Sloan never told us she had friends like you.

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: In fact, we never knew she had any friends period.

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: Why they gotta make my nose so big?

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: Look at my lips.

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: I'm not drinking the Kool-Aid.

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: What are you talkin' about?

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: Jim Jones, y'know.  I'm not drinking the Kool-Aid.

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: Meaning?

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: I'm out.

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: Good.  I've got a broken back from carrying you all these years anyway.

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: So that's what you been doing?

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: Damn skippy.

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: You're in this up till ya neck.

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: Don't shoot me, I'm just the piano players.

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: You can walk away.  We both can.

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: Yeah, that's easy for you to do. You never had any talent.

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: I'm so tired of you running that. I always worked hard for you.  You think I'm a leech, a kling-on, I quit.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Good morning, Cheeba.

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: Good morning to you, Mr. Delapot.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: De-la-croix.

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: Y'know what I mean.  Got a gig yet for Manray and I yet?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Sloan and I have been looking all over for you.

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: You'd take no offense if we called you DeLa for short?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: No offense.

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: Manray needs a job.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I have this concept for a TV pilot. There's no guarantee it will get made but regardless, you'll still make some money.

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: How much?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: First things first.  I have to know if Manray is up for this.

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: What kind of show is this gonna be?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Different.

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: What about in the mean time?  Not the in between time?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: You'll both get an advance and you can stay with me.

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: Nice to meet you.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: And this is Manray.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Gentlemen, the show, our show will be satirical.  You know what that is, don't you?  Trust me on this one.

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: We might need some mo' money behind this.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: That can be done.

turns.speaker: MANRAY
turns.text: I'm starvin' like Marvin.

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: My world famous, famous world Arroz con pollo will be ready very soon.

turns.speaker: MANRAY
turns.text: Hurry up, I wanna watch HBO.

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: Did we get our bill yet?

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: Ahh, the luxuries of life.

turns.speaker: MANRAY
turns.text: Yo, check it.  This is good and all that but one day soon I want to have much Benjamins so I can have a nice crib and pay all my bills. You hear me.

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: Chill, I'm the brains behind this outfit.

turns.speaker: MANRAY
turns.text: And I'm the feet.

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: Yo, you gotta show some patience. You want me to snap my fingers and presto chango - you're an overnight sensation.  Son, there is no such thing.

turns.speaker: MANRAY
turns.text: I'm tired of waiting.

turns.speaker: MANRAY
turns.text: We ran out without my shoes and the floor.  I gotta get my stuff.  What about our savings?

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: Are you crazy?  The joint is crawling with cops now.  You wanna go to Rikers?  Go to the hoosegow?

turns.speaker: MANRAY
turns.text: We got evicted from our home. We've both been on the streets for the last week.

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: We was coming to see you.

turns.speaker: MANRAY
turns.text: If it's not too much trouble could you order us some food?

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: We're starving.

turns.speaker: CHEEBA
turns.text: That ain't funny.

turns.speaker: MANRAY
turns.text: DeLa, I don't know 'bout this.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Manray, Sloan says you're too talented to be dancing on the street.

turns.speaker: MANRAY
turns.text: Well do something about it.

turns.speaker: MANRAY
turns.text: My tap shoes.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: EUREKA!!

turns.speaker: MANRAY
turns.text: What do I have to do?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Some tap dancing, some singing.

turns.speaker: MANRAY
turns.text: Where do I sign?

turns.speaker: MANRAY
turns.text: How different?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Trust me.  Of course I still have to pitch it to my boss, but we'll have an answer one way or the other.

turns.speaker: MANRAY
turns.text: DeLa, I'm aboard.  As long as I get to hoof and get paid too!!!

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: That's right.  Money turns the wheel.
